servinfo.title: DTC P0235: Boost Pressure Sensor Circuit

attention2.ptxt: This fault can result in a rapid and significant fouling of the diesel particulate filter.

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying the fault finding procedure to stored faults:
When an attempt is made to start the engine
Use service wire for all operations on the ECM connectors.
The turbocharging pressure value changes to safe mode: “Turbo Pressure” on Data List of SUZUKI scan tool = 1000 hPa.
The Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.
Order of priority in the event of more than one fault:
Deal with fault DTC P0641: Sensor Reference Voltage 1 Circuit:For Diesel Engine Model first if it is present or stored.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (DSL) .

entry.ptxt: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CO0: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground

entry.ptxt: Check the boost pressure sensor connections.
Check the continuity and insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C76-3” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-42” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C76-74” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-19” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the boost pressure sensor.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC1: Short circuit to +12 V

entry.ptxt: Check the boost pressure sensor connections.
Check the continuity and insulation against +12 volts of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C76-3” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-42” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C76-14” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-45” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C76-4” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-19” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the boost pressure sensor.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for D1: Inconsistency of signal

entry.ptxt: In the event of a number of faults with DTC P0105: Barometric Pressure Circuit:For Diesel Engine Model , display parameter “Turbo Pressure” on Data List of SUZUKI scan tool.
If this value is locked at 1000 hPa and “Barometric Pres” on Data List of SUZUKI scan tool is displaying a different value, replace the boost pressure sensor.
Check the boost pressure sensor connections.
Check the following connections for continuity and make sure there is no interference resistance:

item.ptxt: Between “C76-3” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-42” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C76-1” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-45” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C76-4” wire of boost pressure sensor connector and “C86-19” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the boost pressure sensor.
